intro: Conostegia subhirsuta, commonly known as the hairy conostegia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Melastomataceae. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil and Peru. The plant is characterized by its small, showy flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It has hairy leaves and stems, which contribute to its common name. Conostegia subhirsuta is often found in moist, shaded environments such as rainforests and undergrowth.
